items.title: Trump could paralyze a key U.S. surveillance watchdog, threatening Big Tech’s ability to serve Europe
items.description: The Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board (PCLOB) may lose its ability to function by the end of Thursday, undermining a key U.S.-EU agreement.

items.title: Are famous short sellers going extinct? The exit of Hindenburg Research and Andrew Left shows the risky trade is shrinking
items.description: Indicted short seller Andrew Left tells Fortune a “chilling effect” is making “everyone think twice.”

items.title: House approves Laken Riley Act immigrant detention bill that would be Trump’s first law to sign
items.description: A crucial faction of 46 politically vulnerable Democrats joined with Republicans to lift the strict proposal to passage on a 263-156 vote tally.

items.title: How Nike’s new CEO plans to rebound from its worst year ever
items.description: A Fortune profile of Elliott Hill chronicles his career journey at the retailer and a turnaround strategy.

items.title: Yan-David Erlich, former Weights and Biases executive, joins B Capital as general partner
items.description: Yan-David Erlich, previously CRO and COO at AI unicorn Weights & Biases, is joining B Capital, he exclusively tells Fortune.
